result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane B. Sahm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**3 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: With case 21CF1124.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane B. Sahm

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $728.66
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Proposed Restitution Ordered
*See Plea Hearing docket.*

(1:52 PM cases 21CF1124, 22CF129 called.) Defendant Shane B. Sahm in court. Attorney George E. Miller in court for Shane B. Sahm. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 21CF1124, 22CF129 and Court accepts waivers.
State will file an Information in both cases which will mirror the complaints. 
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF1124 Count 2: Possession of Methamphetamine as Party to a Crime, 22CF129 Count 2: Receiving Stolen Property (<=$2,500) and Count 4: Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2,500).
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CF1124 Count 2, 22CF129 Count 2 and Count 4.
Attorney Miller requests the defendant's items be returned or that the seized non-stolen items be returned or at least no items be destroyed.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
90 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on 21CF1124 Count 2. Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and follow through with recommendations. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. No contact with T.W., R.B., M.S., T.S. or their residences. Restitution in the amount of $728.66 plus 5% and 10% surcharges on 22CF129 Count 2. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 1 day credit on 21CF1124 and 3 days credit on 22CF129 if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 

Court orders any agreed upon non-stolen property may be returned to the defendant.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)
Same as Complaint.
